page.title: 06 HISTORY OF KENNINGTON-2
page.content: Over the years many famous people have visited {KENNINGTON},for instance Queen Victoria and her children are said to have visited and stayed in { {BURTON HOUSE}in{NETTERFIELDS}at { {BYBROOK.}There were gallows at what is now known as {SPEARPOINT CORNER}, as well as on at{PENLEE POINT}used to warn incoming travellers of the strict laws of{KENNINGTON.}What is now called {FAVERSHAM ROAD}was once a toll road with the main toll house being the small house outside the {TOWERS SCHOOL of today. There is a church along { {ULLEY ROAD}called {ST.MARY'S}which was built in 1270 which is part of the Church of England. During the Second World War, a plane crashed into a garden which is now part of Church Road.
